snippet: Expected to cost at least $27 billion, the plan will include installation of advanced signaling technology on subway and railroad systems.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority chairman Thomas F Prendergast says MTA plans to proceed with Phase Two of the Second Avenue subway project, which is an extension to 125th Street, as part of its proposed five-year capital plan to be presented to its board.
lead_paragraph: Expected to cost at least $27 billion, the plan will include installation of advanced signaling technology on subway and railroad systems.

headline.main: M.T.A. Chief Gives Preview of Proposed Five-Year Capital Plan
headline.print_headline: M.T.A. Chief Gives Preview of Proposed Five-Year Capital Plan
